name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

weaknesses: 4 energy for Mega Drain is expensive

competitiveHistory: Butterfree rarely saw competitive play due to being a Stage 2 with low HP and expensive attacks. The healing from Mega Drain was interesting but not enough to justify the investment.

rulings.ruling: Mega Drain heals Butterfree for half the damage dealt (after Weakness/Resistance), rounded up to nearest 10.
If Mega Drain does 40 damage, Butterfree heals 20 damage. If it does 80 (with Weakness), Butterfree heals 40.
Whirlwind does damage first, then opponent chooses which Benched Pokemon becomes active.
